intro: Zornia cearensis, commonly known as the Brazilian burrweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny seed pods. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it produces small white or pale yellow flowers. Zornia cearensis is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various insects.
